meanings.definition: The act of using technical terminology or specialized language.
meanings.sent1: In the meeting, the engineer's jargoning about algorithms left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The jargoning in the scientific paper made it difficult for non-experts to understand.
meanings.sent3: The jargoning of the IT specialist sounded like a secret code to the rest of the team.
meanings.sent4: Her jargoning in computer programming was like speaking a different language.
meanings.sent5: The jargoning of the mechanic was so complex that even other mechanics struggled to follow.

meanings.definition: Speaking in a confusing or unintelligible way.
meanings.sent1: The professor's jargoning explanation of the theory left the students bewildered.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the jargoning salesperson at the store, preferring clear explanations.
meanings.sent3: The jargoning politician's speech made the audience wonder if he was making any sense at all.
meanings.sent4: His jargoning manner of speaking was like listening to a foreign language.
meanings.sent5: The jargoning tone of the customer service representative only added to the confusion.
